doc.after: The F-35 features a full-panel-width glass cockpit touchscreen[307] "panoramic cockpit display" (PCD), with dimensions of 20 by 8Â inches (50 by 20Â centimeters).[308] A cockpit speech-recognition system (DVI) provided by Adacel has been adopted on the F-35 and the aircraft will be the first operational U.S. fixed-wing aircraft to employ this DVI system, although similar systems have been used on the AV-8B Harrier II and trialled in previous aircraft, such as the F-16 VISTA.[309]
